intro: Pedicularis cyathophylla, commonly known as the yellow monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant produces striking yellow flowers with a distinctive hooded structure, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows and forested areas. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in several countries.
